definition: to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: While Charles was in prison, Sydney Carton had also arrived in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 當查爾斯在坐牢時，悉尼卡爾登也來到了巴黎。

sentences.english: He was found guilty by the court-martial and sentenced to imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 軍事法庭判他有罪並判他坐牢。

sentences.english: He began poor, panhandled , ended in jail.
sentences.chinese: 他開始受窮，行乞，最後坐牢。

sentences.english: The old lags used to joke on the convict boats.
sentences.chinese: 多次坐牢的慣犯過去常在囚船上開玩笑。

sentences.english: You can even get behind bars in one of the cells, if you dare.
sentences.chinese: 如果有膽量，你可以進到裏面體驗一把坐牢的感覺。

sentences.english: B: Your lawyer can't help you now. You’re going to jail.
sentences.chinese: 你的律師現在可幫不上忙，你得坐牢。

sentences.english: Even the light punishment criminal may also receive training the generation to be imprisoned.
sentences.chinese: 甚至輕刑罪犯也可以受訓代受坐牢。

sentences.english: Beyond the possibility of rearrest, Suu Kyi's safety is an even more fundamental concern.
sentences.chinese: 除了坐牢，昂山素季最讓人擔心的還是她的生命安全。

sentences.english: He spent two months in prison before he broke out.
sentences.chinese: 他越獄逃走之前在獄中坐牢兩個月。

sentences.english: The thief did not get off lightly and was sentenced to ten years in jail.
sentences.chinese: 小偷並沒有被輕率地放走，而是被處罰坐牢十年。

sentences.english: They can take me to jail.
sentences.chinese: 他們可以讓我去坐牢，反正我付不起。

sentences.english: He was imprisoned for creating a public disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 他因擾亂公共治安而坐牢。

sentences.english: Don't go away, otherwise will go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 不要走邪道，否則會坐牢。

sentences.english: If he goes to jail, what happens to Val?
sentences.chinese: 如果他去坐牢，薇爾怎麼辦？

sentences.english: Prison has branded him for life.
sentences.chinese: 坐牢使他一生在心上留下了烙印。

sentences.english: People go to jail for doing what I do.
sentences.chinese: 人們去坐牢便是履行我的思考。

definition: to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to face legal action/to get sued
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
